name: Ketorolac + Lisinopril â€” Triple Whammy Nephrotoxicity
description: 55-year-old male with hypertension (on Lisinopril) admitted post-surgery. Started on Ketorolac for pain management. Progressive renal decline from dual hemodynamic insult to glomerular perfusion.

steps.narrative: Post-op day 0. Ketorolac started for pain. Lisinopril continued from home meds. Static system flags. Context-aware: silent, renal function adequate.
Early renal impact. Creatinine trending up with potassium. Informational note.
GFR dropped significantly. Potassium rising (both drugs impair K+ excretion). WARNING alert.
CRITICAL. Pre-renal AKI from dual hemodynamic insult. Hyperkalemia risk. Discontinue Ketorolac immediately, switch to Acetaminophen.
